title: Beef Tagliata With Arugula Recipe
summary: Beef Tagliata With Arugula Recipe might be just the hor d'oeuvre you are searching for. This gluten free, primal, and fodmap friendly recipe serves 25 and costs $1.26 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 15g of protein, 22g of fat, and a total of 303 calories. 5 people found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up baby, parmigiano reggiano, extra virgin olive oil, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 10 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 75%. This score is solid. Similar recipes are Grilled Beef Tagliata With Arugula Salad, Tagliata with Arugula, and Tagliatan Of Bone-in Rib-eye With Arugula.
instructions: Lightly season the two pieces of beef with salt and then place on the grill and cook for 2 minutes on each side and then allow to rest for another 4 minutes.Once rested slice the meat diagonally with a sharp knife into about five pieces, drizzle a little olive oil over the meat and sprinkle a pinch of sea salt.Arrange the beef between two plates. Put the rocket around and over the beef.Finally use a small knife to flake the Parmesan into little chunks and sprinkle over the beef. Drizzle with olive oil and serve with a half lemon.

steps.step: Lightly season the two pieces of beef with salt and then place on the grill and cook for 2 minutes on each side and then allow to rest for another 4 minutes.Once rested slice the meat diagonally with a sharp knife into about five pieces, drizzle a little olive oil over the meat and sprinkle a pinch of sea salt.Arrange the beef between two plates.
Put the rocket around and over the beef.Finally use a small knife to flake the Parmesan into little chunks and sprinkle over the beef.
Drizzle with olive oil and serve with a half lemon.
